did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Records of Kennecott Copper Corporation, Braden Unit, 1938-1953.
did.abstract: This collection is comprised of three bound volumes. The first volume, dated 1938 - 1952, describes the history, geology, mining methods and mine safety, complete with accompanying maps, photographs, and charts, of the Braden Unit of the Kennecott Copper Corporation. The second volume, dated 1943 - 1952, contains a set of blueprints of diamond drilling equipment. The third volume, which is undated, contains construction plans and calculations for various mining operations and buildings.

repository.label: Repository

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Records of Kennecott Copper Corporation, Braden Unit, 1938-1953 (MS 158). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Brandon Sewell and William Branden founded the Braden Cooper Company in 1904. In 1905 the company purchased the El Teniente copper mine in Chile and built roads for carts to transport the ore as well as a concentrating plant. In 1915, The Kennecott Copper Corporation secured a controlling interest in the Braden Copper Company. The Chilean government purchased a 51% stake in the mine in 1967, establishing the Sociedad Minera El Teniente. Under this agreement, a new concentrator was built which vastly expanded the mine’s daily production. In 1971, El Teniente became a state owned operation under the Chilean nationalization of copper under President Salvador Allende.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 3 series. Arrangement varies by series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Includes an account of the history, geology, mining methods and mine safety, with accompanying maps, photographs, and charts, of the Braden Unit of the Kennecott Copper Corporation. This was prepared for the American Mining Congress in 1952-1953; the charts are dated from 1938 through 1952, and the six photographs are of equipment. Also includes a set of blueprints of diamond drilling equipment, dated 1943 to 1952; and construction plans and calculations for various mining operations and buildings.
